item.title: 消息人士称，中国电动卡车初创企业 Windrose 将在美国上市前融资 2 亿美元
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士说，中国电动卡车初创企业风卓公司（Windrose）的目标是在寻求在美国首次公开募股之前，在最后一轮融资中通过股权投资和债务融资筹集 2 亿美元。【原文：Chinese electric truck startup Windrose is aiming to raise $200 million in its final round of funding in equity investments and debt before it seeks an initial public offering in the United States, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 工会称三星电子与工会的谈判无果而终
item.description: 三星电子和韩国最大的工会代表周二举行了会谈，但会谈无果而终。【原文：Samsung Electronics and representatives of its biggest workers' union in South Korea, which has been on a strike, met on Tuesday but the talks ended without results, the union said.】

item.title: 由于制片厂和主题公园业务疲软，康卡斯特季度收入不及预期
item.description: 本周二，康卡斯特公司的季度营收未达预期，原因是这家美国电信和媒体公司在此期间上映的电影数量减少，而其主题公园的入园率也持续走低。【原文：Comcast missed estimates for quarterly revenue on Tuesday as the U.S. telecom and media firm had fewer movie releases during the period, while attendance at its theme parks stayed low.】

item.title: 需求稳定，可口可乐上调年度销售额和利润预期
item.description: 可口可乐公司周二上调了年度有机销售额和利润预期，表明这家饮料巨头在美国和国际市场对其汽水、能量饮料和果汁的需求强劲。【原文：Coca-Cola raised its annual organic sales and profit forecast on Tuesday, signaling strong demand for the beverage giant's sodas, energy drinks and juices in its U.S. and international markets.】

item.title: 日本航空公司订购 20 架空客 A350 型飞机和 11 架 A321neos 型飞机
item.description: 空中客车公司飞机制造主管克里斯蒂安-舍勒（Christian Scherer）周二在范堡罗航展上表示，日本航空公司已经订购了20架空客A350-900和11架A321neo飞机。【原文：Japan Airlines has ordered 20 Airbus A350-900 and 11 A321neo planes, Airbus's planemaking chief Christian Scherer said at the Farnborough Airshow on Tuesday.】

item.title: 金佰利上调年度利润预期，第二季度每股收益因价格上涨而超出预期
item.description: Kleenex 纸巾制造商金佰利-克拉克公司周二上调了全年利润预期，此前该公司第二季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，押注于其个人护理产品价格上涨和需求稳定。【原文：Kleenex tissue maker Kimberly-Clark on Tuesday raised its forecast for full-year profit after beating Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit, betting on higher prices and steady demand for its personal care products.】

item.title: 通用汽车搁置不带方向盘的自动驾驶汽车
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）的 Cruise 自动驾驶部门表示，将把开发重点放在下一代雪佛兰 Bolt 上，而不是其计划中的没有方向盘或其他人工控制装置的未来主义 Origin 汽车上。【原文：General Motors' Cruise self-driving unit will focus its development efforts on a next-generation Chevrolet Bolt rather than its planned futuristic Origin vehicle that would not have a steering wheel or other human controls, the automaker said.】

item.title: 通用汽车第二季度业绩超出预期，再次上调业绩预期
item.description: 通用汽车公司周二公布的第二季度利润和收入均超出华尔街预期，并在今年第二次上调了全年利润预期，这主要得益于强劲的价格和对汽油动力卡车的需求。【原文：General Motors reported second-quarter profit and revenue on Tuesday that beat Wall Street's expectations, and raised its annual profit forecast for a second time this year, buoyed by strong pricing and demand for gas-powered trucks.】

item.title: 发动机零部件和服务需求强劲，通用电气航空航天集团上调 2024 年盈利预期
item.description: 通用电气航空航天公司周二上调了年度盈利预期，原因是新飞机短缺促使航空公司继续保留旧飞机，从而对包括喷气发动机零部件在内的售后服务需求强劲。【原文：GE Aerospace raised its annual profit forecast on Tuesday on strong demand for its aftermarket services, including jet-engine parts, as a shortage of new planes prompted airlines to keep older ones in the air.】

item.title: 印度联合利华第一季度利润增长
item.description: 印度的印度斯坦联合利华公司周二公布第一季度利润增长，原因是期待已久的农村经济复苏引发了核心部门的需求复苏。【原文：India's Hindustan Unilever posted a higher first-quarter profit on Tuesday, as much awaited rural recovery sparked demand revival in core segments.】

item.title: 早间新闻大盘报告，哈里斯入选，中国摇摆不定
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 焦点转向科技财报，期货下跌
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货下滑，因为一些大型科技公司将在当天晚些时候发布财报，这些公司的财报将被用来分析市场近期破纪录的走势是否可持续。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Tuesday ahead of results from some Big Tech companies expected later in the day that will be parsed to see whether the market's recent record-breaking run is sustainable.】

item.title: 劳动力成本高企，小包装需求疲软，UPS 季度利润下滑
item.description: 联合包裹服务公司（United Parcel Service）周二公布的第二季度财报显示，由于包裹递送需求低迷以及与美国运输工人工会（Teamsters）签订的劳动合同导致成本上升，利润受到挤压，该公司第二季度盈利出现下滑。【原文：United Parcel Service reported a decline in second-quarter earnings on Tuesday after subdued package delivery demand and higher costs from its Teamsters labor contract squeezed profits.】

item.title: 哈里斯总统将接过打击金融业的接力棒
item.description: 由副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）领导的潜在民主党政府很可能会推进总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）制定严厉金融规则的议程，这对华尔街银行、加密货币公司和其他在现政府统治下备受煎熬的参与者来说是一个不受欢迎的前景。【原文：A potential Democratic administration led by Vice President Kamala Harris would likely advance President Joe Biden's agenda of tough financial rules, an unwelcome prospect for Wall Street banks, crypto companies and other players that have chafed under the current administration.】

item.title: 美国现货以太坊 ETF 将在市场上首次亮相，这是加密货币行业的又一次胜利
item.description: 美国首批与以太坊价格挂钩的交易所交易基金（ETF）将于本周二开始交易，以太坊是仅次于比特币的全球第二大加密货币，这是加密货币行业推动主流化的又一个分水岭。【原文：The first U.S. exchange-traded funds (ETFs) tied to the price of ether, the world's second-largest cryptocurrency after bitcoin, are due to begin trading on Tuesday, in another watershed event for the crypto industry's push to go mainstream.】

item.title: 聚焦：Neuralink 的价值飙升让马斯克的一些员工迫不及待地想套现离场
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的神经链接公司（Neuralink）的部分员工正准备出售这家大脑植入公司的股票。【原文：Some of the staff at Elon Musk's Neuralink are making preparations to sell the brain implant company's stock in the wake of its valuation jumping following its first human trial, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Spotify 收入略低于预期，用户增长未达目标
item.description: Spotify 周二公布的季度业绩基本符合分析师的预期，但未能达到自己的用户增长目标。【原文：Spotify reported quarterly results broadly in line with analyst expectations on Tuesday, but failed to meet its own target for user growth.】

item.title: 维珍航空再订购七架空中客车 A330neos
item.description: 维珍航空周二在范堡罗航展上表示，该公司已再订购七架空中客车 A330-900 飞机。【原文：Virgin Atlantic has ordered a further seven Airbus A330-900 planes, the airline said at the Farnborough Airshow on Tuesday.】

item.title: 因电池起火风险，Stellantis 将在美国召回约 1.95 万辆混合动力汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周二表示，Stellantis公司将在美国召回19516辆混合动力汽车，因为这些汽车的电池组在停车时可能会导致车辆起火。【原文：Stellantis is recalling 19,516 hybrid vehicles in the U.S. as their battery pack may cause a vehicle fire when parked, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Grab 收购新加坡餐饮预订平台 Chope
item.description: 据东南亚最大的叫车和送餐公司 Grab 和新加坡餐饮预订平台 Chope 周二确认，两家公司已收购新加坡餐饮预订平台 Chope，具体价格未透露。【原文：Grab , Southeast Asia's biggest ride-hailing and food delivery firm, has bought Singaporean dining reservation platform Chope for an undisclosed price, according to confirmation from both companies on Tuesday.】

item.title: Forvia 和比亚迪将在欧洲建立亚洲合作伙伴关系
item.description: 世界第七大汽车零部件供应商福维亚公司周二表示，将把与中国电池专家和汽车制造商比亚迪的合作带到欧洲。【原文：The world's seventh largest car parts supplier Forvia will bring its partnership with Chinese battery specialist and car maker BYD to Europe, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 丰田将以 51.6 亿美元要约收购自身股份
item.description: 此次回购是在东京证券交易所推动治理，促使各大公司解除交叉持股的背景下进行的。【原文：The buyback comes amid a governance push by the Tokyo Stock Exchange that has prompted major companies to unwind cross-shareholdings.】

item.title: 江森自控将以 67 亿美元向博世出售暖通资产
item.description: 江森自控国际公司（JCI）周二表示，将以 67 亿美元的价格向德国博世集团出售其暖通设备组合。【原文：Johnson Controls International (JCI) said on Tuesday that it will sell a portfolio of its heating and ventilation units to Germany's Bosch Group for $6.7 billion.】

item.title: 高盛收购澳大利亚物流地产，加强房地产投资组合
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group）的另类投资平台周二表示，该公司在澳大利亚购买了七处以物流为主的物业，以扩大其房地产投资组合。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group's alternative investments platform said on Tuesday it bought seven logistics-focused properties across Australia to scale up its real estate portfolio.】

item.title: 大众汽车在中国市场陷入困境。电动汽车能否帮助它在美国实现增长？
item.description: 上个月，大众汽车集团向美国电动卡车和 SUV 制造商 Rivian 投资 50 亿美元，该公司股价因现金注入而飙升。【原文：When Volkswagen Group last month invested $5 billion in U.S. electric truck-and-SUV maker Rivian , the startup's shares soared on the cash infusion.】

item.title: 日本内阁官房长官呼吁广泛涨薪
item.description: 日本政府最高发言人 Yoshimasa Hayashi 表示，扩大小型企业的加薪范围至关重要，这凸显了政府为实现持续工资增长所做的努力。【原文：Broadening pay hikes among smaller firms is crucial, said Japan's top government spokesperson, Yoshimasa Hayashi, underscoring the administration's drive to achieve sustained wage gains.】

item.title: 泰国今年迄今已接待 1960 万外国游客
item.description: 泰国旅游部周二表示，1 月至 7 月 21 日期间，泰国共接待了 1960 万外国游客，比去年同期增长了 34%。【原文：Thailand recorded 19.6 million foreign tourist arrivals from January to July 21 period, the Tourism Ministry said Tuesday, up 34% from the same period a year earlier.】

item.title: 美国股市平静中的裂痕提升了投资组合保护的诱惑力
item.description: 由于美股面临政治不确定性、巨额科技收益和季节性疲软，投资者正寻求投资组合的保护，以避免美股在一段时期内可能出现的波动。【原文：Investors are eyeing portfolio protection from a potentially rough stretch in U.S. stocks as they face political uncertainty, big tech earnings and seasonal weakness.】

item.title: Cryptoverse：就像没有收益的债券？投资者对以太坊 ETF 持不同看法
item.description: 以太坊要摆脱比特币的阴影可能还需要一点时间。【原文：It may take a little more time for ether to edge out of bitcoin's shadow.】

item.title: 瑞士宝盛银行任命高盛高管为新任首席执行官
item.description: 瑞士私人银行瑞士宝盛周二表示，已聘请高盛（Goldman Sachs）合伙人斯特凡-博林格（Stefan Bollinger）担任新任首席执行官。【原文：Julius Baer has hired Goldman Sachs partner Stefan Bollinger to be its new chief executive, the Swiss private bank said on Tuesday.】
